com.mappedin.sdk

Class MapViewCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mappedin.sdk.MapViewCamera

  • public class MapViewCamera
extends java.lang.Object
    The MapViewCamera allows you to control the camera on the MapView. Adjust the position, rotation, and zoom level

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MapViewCamera.AutomaticZoomType 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float maxPitch
      This property controls the maximum camera pitch, in radians.
      float maxZoom
      This property controls how far the camera can zoom out (actually how far the camera is from the scene).
      float minPitch
      This property controls the minimum camera pitch, in radians.
      float minZoom
      This property controls how far the camera can zoom in (actually how far the camera is from the scene).

    • Field Detail

      • maxPitch

        public float maxPitch
        This property controls the maximum camera pitch, in radians. If you set this too high, you would be able to rotate under the venue.

      • minPitch

        public float minPitch
        This property controls the minimum camera pitch, in radians. If you set this below 0, the user will be able to pitch so everything is upside down

      • maxZoom

        public float maxZoom
        This property controls how far the camera can zoom out (actually how far the camera is from the scene).

      • minZoom

        public float minZoom
        This property controls how far the camera can zoom in (actually how far the camera is from the scene).

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        public android.util.Pair<java.lang.Float,java.lang.Float> getPosition()
        get the camera's current x and y position.
        Returns:
        Pair (x, y)

      • setPositionTo

        public void setPositionTo(float x,
                 float y)
        Controls the camera's x and y position. NOTE: The coordinates used don't really mean anything at this stage, so don't hardcode them as they will change.
        Parameters:
        x - x value
        y - y value

      • getRotation

        public android.util.Pair<java.lang.Float,java.lang.Float> getRotation()
        Gets the pitch (up and down) and yaw (clockwise around the map) of the camera in radians.
        Returns:
        Pair(pitch, yaw)

      • setRotationTo

        public void setRotationTo(float pitch,
                 float yaw)
        Controls the pitch (up and down) and yaw (clockwise around the map) of the camera. 0 pitch and 0 yaw would be looking straight down on the map in it’s default orientation
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch (up and down) in radians
        yaw - the yaw (clockwise around the map) in radians

      • getZoom

        public float getZoom()
        Gets the distance between camera ane the point camera looks at
        Returns:
        the distance (The units used here don’t mean anything right now)

      • setZoomTo

        public void setZoomTo(float high)
        Controls how close the camera is to the map. The units used here don’t mean anything right now
        Parameters:
        high - distance between camera ane the point camera looks at

      • focusOn

        public void focusOn(Coordinate coordinate)
        Focuses the camera on a specific Coordinate. Will change maps if required. Does not affect zoom level.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinates to focus on

      • focusOn

        public void focusOn(Polygon polygon)
        Focuses the camera on a specific Polygon, camera will automatically zoom in or out to fit the polygon into view.
        Parameters:
        polygon - The Polygon to focus in on

      • focusOn

        public void focusOn(Polygon polygon,
           MapViewCamera.AutomaticZoomType autoZoom)
        Focuses the camera on a specific Polygon
        Parameters:
        polygon - The Polygon to focus in on
        autoZoom - Whether the camera should automatically zoom in, out or both to fit the polygon into view. Can also specify none for no zoom behaviour.

      • focusOn

        public void focusOn(java.util.List<Coordinate> coordinates)
        Focus on a list of Coordinates. Ideal for showing a path, camera will automatically zoom in or out to fit
        Parameters:
        coordinates - An array of Coordinate objects to ensure they are all in focus

      • focusOn

        public void focusOn(java.util.List<Coordinate> coordinates,
           MapViewCamera.AutomaticZoomType autoZoom)
        Focus on a list of Coordinates. Ideal for showing a path.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - An array of Coordinate objects to ensure they are all in focus
        autoZoom - Whether to zoom the camera in, out, or just move it.
